radiographic_examinations.findings: A solitary fat-containing tumor arising from the region of the superior cerebellar hemisphere and vermis, measuring 4.4 × 4.1 × 4.3 cm, with patchy enhancement, complete effacement of the fourth ventricle, and displacement of the cerebellar tonsils through the foramen magnum.
A large, poorly enhancing, lipomatous mass emanating from the superior vermis, producing marked compression of posterior fossa structures.
Near-total resection was achieved with a small remnant of tumor left adherent to deep veins near the galenic confluence.
